alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 3:20PM EST until January 14 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 6 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow showers are expected to start over the high elevations late tonight. Snow levels will gradually fall to the valley floors by Friday morning. Expect total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches in valleys and 2 to 4 inches at elevations above 1,500 feet. Localized snowfall amounts exceeding 4 inches are possible over the highest portions of Black Mountain. * WHERE...Bell, Harlan, Letcher and Pike Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 6 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions at the highest elevations by early Friday morning where temperatures fall below freezing first. Conditions will slowly worsen at lower elevations during the day on Friday and especially Friday evening as snow levels fall and temperatures cool to and below freezing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heavier snow accumulations are expected to impact the higher elevation roadways including US-421 and US- 119 crossing Pine Mountain, KY-160 and KY-179 crossing Black Mountain, KY-932 at Flat Gap, KY-38 at Morris Gap and KY-74 crossing the Log Mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
